IgG Subclass Antibody Response in
Grass Pollen-Allergic Patients Undergoing

Prognostic Value of Serum IgG Subclass Antibody Levels Early in Immunotherapy

front.div:
All four subclasses of IgG antibodies to timothy grass pollen extract were measured by a
three-layer immunoradiometric assay in sera from 20 grass pollen-allergic patients who
underwent specific immunotherapy in a 3-year prospective study. Both IgGl and IgG4
antibody levels rose significantly during the first 8 weeks of immunotherapy, IgGl antibody
level passed its peak (median 5,4 U/ml) after 12 weeks. At tbis time, the ratio between the
medians of IgGl and IgG4 autibodies was 2,25, lgCi4 antibody level reacbed its peak
(median 11,6 U/ml) just before termination of immunotherapy. At this time lgGl/IgG4
-ratio was 0,43, Two years after the end of immunotherapy, lgCl aud lgG4 antibody levels
were 0,0 and 1,8 U/ml in median, respectively. The amounts of lgG2 and IgG3 antibodies
detected in the sera were less than 1,6 U/ml and were considered insignificant, Preseasonal
serum IgGl and IgG4 antibody levels did not correlate significantly with symptom scores in
the subsequent season. Serum IgG4 level obtained after 12 weeks of immunotberapy was
significantly correlated to symptom score in the third season, i,e, the season just after
-termination of therapy (75 = 0,529, t = 2,567, P = 0,02), In this work, a serum lgG4
antibody level bigher than 8,0 U/ml after 12 weeks of therapy predicted poor clinical result
at the end of immunotherapy with 100% sensitivity and 87% specificity. An IgG4/IgGl
ratio greater than 1,0 after 12 weeks' therapy had the same predictive value.
